title: China’s Mass Covid Testing to Test Country’s Finances, Too
sub_head: Beijing’s plans to prevent another Shanghai-style lockdown—while spending heavily on infrastructure—could prove costly
body:
China’s stringent approach toward controlling Covid-19 has dealt a heavy blow to its economy. As Beijing now tries to aggressively increase stimulus, its evolving measures to combat the virus would also test the government’s push to reduce debt and financial risks.
The Chinese government has rolled out a spate of stimulus initiatives in recent weeks, including tax rebates and big spending on infrastructure, aiming to revive an economy that was kneecapped by lockdowns in Shanghai and other cities this spring.
